library.Title: The Dark Knight
library.Writer: Jonathan Nolan (screenplay), Christopher Nolan (screenplay), Christopher Nolan (story), David S. Goyer (story), Bob Kane (characters)
library.Actors: Christian Bale, Heath Ledger, Aaron Eckhart, Michael Caine
library.Plot: When the menace known as the Joker wreaks havoc and chaos on the people of Gotham, the caped crusader must come to terms with one of the greatest psychological tests of his ability to fight injustice.

library.Title: The Dark Knight Rises
library.Writer: Jonathan Nolan (screenplay), Christopher Nolan (screenplay), Christopher Nolan (story), David S. Goyer (story), Bob Kane (characters)
library.Actors: Christian Bale, Gary Oldman, Tom Hardy, Joseph Gordon-Levitt
library.Plot: Eight years after the Joker's reign of anarchy, the Dark Knight, with the help of the enigmatic Selia, is forced from his imposed exile to save Gotham City, now on the edge of total annihilation, from the brutal guerrilla terrorist Bane.
library.Awards: Nominated for 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 44 wins & 98 nominations.

library.Title: Gladiator
library.Writer: David Franzoni (story), David Franzoni (screenplay), John Logan (screenplay), William Nicholson (screenplay)
library.Actors: Russell Crowe, Joaquin Phoenix, Connie Nielsen, Oliver Reed
library.Plot: When a Roman general is betrayed and his family murdered by an emperor's corrupt son, he comes to Rome as a gladiator to seek revenge.

library.Title: Rambo
library.Writer: Art Monterastelli, Sylvester Stallone, David Morrell (character)
library.Actors: Sylvester Stallone, Julie Benz, Matthew Marsden, Graham McTavish
library.Plot: In Thailand, John Rambo joins a group of mercenaries to venture into war-torn Burma, and rescue a group of Christian aid workers who were kidnapped by the ruthless local infantry unit.

library.Title: The Avengers
library.Writer: Joss Whedon (screenplay), Zak Penn (story), Joss Whedon (story)
library.Actors: Robert Downey Jr., Chris Evans, Mark Ruffalo, Chris Hemsworth
library.Plot: Earth's mightiest heroes must come together and learn to fight as a team if they are to stop the mischievous Loki and his alien army from enslaving humanity.
library.Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 35 wins & 76 nominations.

library.Title: Frozen
library.Writer: Jennifer Lee (screenplay), Hans Christian Andersen (story), Chris Buck (story), Jennifer Lee (story), Shane Morris (story)
library.Actors: Kristen Bell, Idina Menzel, Jonathan Groff, Josh Gad
library.Plot: When the newly crowned Queen Elsa accidentally uses her power to turn things into ice to curse her home in infinite winter, her sister, Anna, teams up with a mountain man, his playful reindeer, and a snowman to change the weather condition.

library.Title: Iron Man
library.Writer: Mark Fergus (screenplay), Hawk Ostby (screenplay), Art Marcum (screenplay), Matt Holloway (screenplay), Stan Lee (characters), Don Heck (characters), Larry Lieber (characters), Jack Kirby (characters)
library.Actors: Robert Downey Jr., Terrence Howard, Jeff Bridges, Gwyneth Paltrow
library.Plot: After being held captive in an Afghan cave, an industrialist creates a unique weaponized suit of armor to fight evil.
library.Awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 19 wins & 58 nominations.

library.Title: Unbroken
library.Writer: Joel Coen (screenplay), Ethan Coen (screenplay), Richard LaGravenese (screenplay), William Nicholson (screenplay), Laura Hillenbrand (book)
library.Actors: Jack O'Connell, Domhnall Gleeson, Garrett Hedlund, Miyavi
library.Plot: After a near-fatal plane crash in WWII, Olympian Louis Zamperini spends a harrowing 47 days in a raft with two fellow crewmen before he's caught by the Japanese navy and sent to a prisoner-of-war camp.
library.Awards: Nominated for 3 Oscars. Another 12 wins & 25 nominations.
